teachers.name: Mr. Stephen Ni
teachers.description: Founder of Vanlearn International Education, with 20 years of university English teaching experience. An IELTS/TOEFL all-subject instructor holding a CERTESL (Certificate in Teaching English as a Second Language). Previously served as a lead reading and writing instructor at well-known training institutions such as New Oriental and Longre. Specializes in teaching and research in Adult ESL, Children’s ELL, and English Reading and Writing courses. Advocates a student-centered teaching philosophy that emphasizes the teacher’s role as a facilitator.

course.title: Public Speaking & Debate
course.overviewText: Leaders of Tomorrow is a professionally designed program dedicated to developing young people's leadership skills. Through time-tested concepts, tutorials, and instructors, we help young people not only overcome the fear and tension of public speaking, but improve effective communication and build confidence in interpersonal communication.

teachers.name: Ms. Jeanie David
teachers.description: Jeanie David is passionate about encouraging and developing speaking and leadership qualities in students. She brings over 30 years' experience teaching and guiding children. Jeanie has taught a variety of ECE classes, as well as Development programs including Public speaking for Grade 1-12.

course.title: Chinese Language Course
course.overviewText: Our Chinese program focuses on developing students’ listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills through engaging, real-life communication. Lessons integrate cultural exploration, including Chinese festivals, calligraphy, and traditions, to deepen understanding and appreciation of Chinese culture. Students build both language proficiency and cross-cultural awareness, gaining confidence to communicate effectively in academic and everyday contexts.

teachers.name: Mr. Bai Jingbo
teachers.education: Graduate of the Academy of Fine Arts, Liaoning Normal University
teachers.description: As a respected Chinese instructor in Canada, Bai Jingbo brings a rich background in media and writing to his teaching. His diverse experience—from university lecturing and journalism at CCTV to professional scriptwriting—has honed his deep expertise in Chinese language and literature. In the classroom, he leverages this unique perspective to help students appreciate linguistic nuances and cultural depth, fostering a learning environment that is both intellectually stimulating and culturally enriching.

teachers.name: Mr. Jing
teachers.description: I am a dedicated Chinese language educator with over 20 years of teaching experience in Canada and China. I am highly familiar with a wide range of Mandarin curricula and teaching methods and specialize in tailoring lessons to meet each student’s individual needs. I believe language learning should be meaningful and enjoyable, so I integrate cultural stories, traditions, and values into my teaching to create engaging and effective learning experiences. My goal is to build students’ confidence and help them develop strong practical communication skills in Mandarin while fostering an appreciation for Chinese culture.

course.title: French Language Course
course.overviewText: French courses focus on building students’ communication skills through practical listening, speaking, reading, and writing activities. Lessons integrate cultural exploration—such as French traditions, art, and daily life—to deepen understanding of the language in context. Through interactive projects and authentic materials, students develop confidence in expressing themselves and gain a global perspective rooted in Francophone culture.

teachers.name: Ms. Yu
teachers.education: Graduate of the Academy of Fine Arts, Liaoning Normal University
teachers.description: With over 10 years of teaching experience, Ms. Yu specializes in watercolor, illustration, and creative design. She inspires young learners to develop artistic expression and cultural understanding through interactive and personalized lessons.

course.title: Japanese Language Course
course.overviewText: Japanese courses focus on developing comprehensive language skills in listening, speaking, reading, and writing. Students not only learn practical communication for daily and academic use but also explore Japanese culture, traditions, and modern society. Through interactive lessons, cultural projects, and real-life language practice, learners gain both linguistic proficiency and cross-cultural understanding, building confidence to connect with the world in Japanese.

teachers.name: Ms. Luo
teachers.description: Specializes in teaching beginner, intermediate, and advanced Japanese. Studied in Japan and currently serves as a lecturer at top “Double World-Class,” 985, and 211 universities in China. With extensive experience in Japanese language teaching and JLPT preparation, she is recognized as an outstanding instructor dedicated to helping students achieve excellence.

course.title: Mathematics Tutoring
course.overviewText: Mathematics courses are designed to develop listening, speaking, reading, and writing abilities in Chinese, French, and Japanese. Emphasis is placed on both linguistic proficiency and cultural literacy, helping students become confident communicators and global citizens.

teachers.name: Mr. Hongxiang Lin
teachers.education: Graduate of the Academy of Fine Arts, Liaoning Normal University
teachers.description: I hold a Master’s Degree in Engineering from McGill University, where I graduated with distinction and earned the Dean’s Honour List and several scholarships. With a strong foundation in mathematics, physics, and analytical problem-solving, I have extensive experience as a Teaching Assistant and Research Assistant, helping students grasp complex STEM concepts clearly and effectively. My academic and professional background allows me to connect theory with real-world applications, making lessons both logical and engaging. I am passionate about guiding students to build confidence and achieve academic success.

course.title: Singapore Math
course.overviewText: Known globally for its structured and problem-solving approach, Singapore Math equips students with strong numerical fluency, logical reasoning, and conceptual understanding. Students are encouraged to think mathematically and apply multiple strategies to solve real-world problems.

course.title: Computer Programming
course.overviewText: Our computer programming course introduces students to coding through Python, Scratch, and creative projects. With a project-based learning approach, students learn to design games, animations, and AI models while developing problem-solving and logical thinking skills. Guided by experienced instructors, this course builds a solid foundation for future study in computer science and technology.

teachers.name: Mr. Mike
teachers.education: Graduate of the Academy of Fine Arts, Liaoning Normal University
teachers.description: Mr. Mike specializes in using real-life examples to explain abstract concepts. He emphasizes personalized teaching and builds students’ confidence through interactive “error analysis” sessions. From illustrating functions with animations to creating fractal art in Python and designing “Geek Challenge” courses, he makes learning both engaging and inspiring. He once guided students to solve the classic “Chickens and Rabbits in the Same Cage” problem through coding—making knowledge both fun and meaningful.

course.title: Piano & Guzheng
course.overviewText: Students receive professional training in music performance and theory, building technical skill, musical expression, and discipline. Playing instruments such as the guzheng and piano not only enhances fine motor coordination but also fosters emotional expression and cultural appreciation.

teachers.name: Ms. Vivian Wang
teachers.description: She graduated from Minzu University of China and Renmin University of China, majoring in piano performance and pedagogy. She has been teaching piano for 18 years and has served as a judge and examiner for piano competitions in China for many years. Her teaching philosophy is individualized, tailoring lesson plans to each student's unique characteristics and needs. She hopes that under her guidance, every student will find their own joy and sense of accomplishment in the world of music.

course.title: Chess
course.overviewText: In partnership with Penny Chess Club, where many international master-level coaches teach, this program sharpens strategic thinking, concentration, and decision-making. Chess builds patience, logic, and resilience, while also offering students opportunities to connect with a global community of learners.

course.title: Creative Art
course.overviewText: Through exploration of the visual and performing arts, students cultivate artistic literacy and creative self-expression. The program encourages imagination, critical thinking, and appreciation for diverse artistic traditions, supporting both personal growth and cultural understanding.

teachers.name: Ms. Bi Yu
teachers.education: Graduate of the Academy of Fine Arts, Liaoning Normal University
description: Graduated from Shandong University of Art & Design with a major in Modeling Arts. In 2022, she completed watercolor and oil painting courses at AUArts . Member of the Alberta Society of Artists.

She has been working in art education since 2011 and has extensive teaching experience. Passionate about painting, she patiently guides her students, many of whom have won awards in North American and Canadian art competitions. She has also been recognized multiple times as an outstanding art instructor
